title: What is this font?
content:
What font is used on the picture?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817001353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_5786.jpg)

| --- | --- |

author: bwebdesign

comments.content:
Hello  
For ANSO:  
 [http://www.whatfontis.com/Blippo-Black-tilde.font?text=RANSPOR](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817001353/http:/www.whatfontis.com/Blippo-Black-tilde.font?text=RANSPOR "http://www.whatfontis.com/Blippo-Black-tilde.font?text=RANSPOR")  
For RP:  
 [http://www.whatfontis.com/MolineBold.font?text=RP](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817001353/http:/www.whatfontis.com/MolineBold.font?text=RP "http://www.whatfontis.com/MolineBold.font?text=RP")  
Alex  
I found it using: [http://www.whatfontis.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817001353/http:/www.whatfontis.com/ "http://www.whatfontis.com") - Identify the font you are looking for!
Great! thanks! Anyway for ANSO Bauhause 93 is very similar too.

Agree with Alex. Most probably a mix of (at leat) 2 different fonts. /R and /P (mainly) remind me of [Stop](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817001353/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/stop), may be simply recreating /R starting from /P and adding a vertical stroke.
